Summary: walking along the beach at night, noticed an unusual light, much too close to be a star, just floating in the sky, investigated.
divs: sighting detailsit was over the summer and i was walking home at around 11 oclock at night, along the beach on a boardwalk. i was looking at the sky over our local pier, roughly 1\4 mile away and i noticed a strange light floating over our pier and the large hotel near it. this light was too far away to see what it was, but it was obviously much too close to be a star, and it couldnt be a plane simply because it was just floating. i watched it the whole way to the pier and when i got there i went up the stairs to these built in binoculars that can be used for 50 cents, i payed and immediately had a look at the strange ball of light. what i saw is rather difficult to explain, the binoculars not being overly powerful, but what i can describe goes like this: the craft was not any set shape, like a saucer or a sphere, it was orbish though in shape though boxy at the edges, almost squarish but with protuding objects that i couldt make out exactly. the craft was orange colored with several different colored lights on it. the objects that i mentioned before, protruded from the craft at many different angles it appeared, like beams or very large, thick antennaes. after viewing the object from the binoculars for a ittle bit, i proceeded to continue walking home, watching it the entire time. it was during this time that i noticed the objects very subtle and slow movement through the night sky, ever-so-smooth and not noticeable if you hadnt seen its original position in the sky. i saw a similar, if not the same object some weeks later, in the same part of town, which i took pictures of, though they only show the ball of light in the dark sky, however, i did also take pictures of the moon and included some sorrounding growth in the picture to have a comparison. i dont have the pictures on hand at this exact moment so i cant include them. please voice your opinion.
trends: There have been 17 other sightings in Ventura
